newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish '96 foreign direct investment hits $5.2 bln.
newsitem.headline: Polish '96 foreign direct investment hits $5.2 bln.

text.p: Poland's 1996 foreign direct investment rose $5.19 billion, pushing the amount attracted since 1990 to more than $12 billion, the government's Foreign Investment Agency (PAIZ) said on Tuesaday.
PAP news agency quoted the PAIZ report as saying that foreign investment was led by U.S. companies, German firms and multi-national corporations.
Italy's Fiat Spa, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the Polish-America Enterprise Fund were the biggest investors, PAP said.
